timeline.message: new suddenhighwaytypechangecheck with simplified logic and more inline with osmose issue 1090.
Merge branch 'dev' of https://github.com/osmlab/atlas-checks into suddenhighwaytypechange
fixing sonar cloud errors and spotless
consolidated conditionals to simplify final method
removing marking connected edges as flagged to maximize detections.

timeline.bodyText: Could we have some documentation here? Even if it's just something  copy pasted from the check's readme -- makes it easier to know what the check does without searching for docs
timeline.author: seancoulter

replies.bodyText: updated! Let me know if there should be more
replies.author: reichg

timeline.bodyText: Hate to be a stickler, but some method docs would be helpful, if not actually the standard for new checks
timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.bodyText: HighwayTag.highwayTag(edge).isPresent() would be redundant after HighwayTag.isCarNavigableHighway(edge)
timeline.author: seancoulter
seancoulter

timeline.bodyText:
this might need to be changed if you use the suggestion I made last ^
&& !edgeBeingVerifiedHighwayTag.equals(HighwayTag.NO)
timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.bodyText: do you think this loop and the one prior could be put into a method, and parameterized with firstEdgeStartNodeEdgesHighwayTags and then lastEdgeEndNodeEdgesHighwayTags ?
timeline.author: seancoulter

replies.bodyText: Did my best to implement these in methods. I have it working with same results and eliminates code smell.
replies.author: reichg

timeline.bodyText: We don't want to change this.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this should be changed.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: This is not necessary, as it will be enabled by default.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: Looks like this needs to be updated.
timeline.author: Bentleysb
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -925,9 +925,19 @@
       "mediumPriorityRule": {
         "condition":"OR",
         "rules":["highway=primary","highway=primary_link","highway=secondary","highway=secondary_link"]
-      },
+      }},
       "tags":"highway"
-    }
+  },
+  "SuddenHighwayTypeChangeCheck":{
+    "enabled": true,
+    "challenge": {
+      "description": "Tasks will include ways that are drawn as a single way, when in reality they should be two or more distinct ways",
+      "blurb": "Snake Roads",
+      "instruction": "Open your favorite editor and split the snake road into two or more distinct ways. You can do this by splitting or separating the existing way at an intersection or where you think a road should end. This check also flags roundabouts that aren’t properly tagged. If you see that’s the case - add a junction=roundabout tag when needed.",
+      "difficulty": "MEDIUM",
+      "defaultPriority": "LOW"

timeline.bodyText: It would be good to have a true positive tests for each of the 3 cases.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText: each case has been added in test
replies.author: reichg

timeline.message: Merge branch 'dev' of https://github.com/reichg/atlas-checks into suddenhighwaytypechange
fixing change requests from pull request.
updated test checks for cases and addressed comments

replies.bodyText: Can you check again for this? It looks like this was a part of one of my last commits

replies.bodyText: So if you look under the "Files Changed" in the PR, it shows the comparison of your branch with the dev branch. So anything in red is deleted from dev and anything in green is newly added. :)
